newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore Changi Airport volume up 7.5 pct - report.
newsitem.headline: Singapore Changi Airport volume up 7.5 pct - report.

text.p: The Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) said on Wednesday passenger traffic at the island republic's Changi Airport rose 7.5 percent in 1996 to 24.5 million people, according to a state television report.
It said air freight gained 7.7 percent and commercial aircraft movements increased 6.7 percent in 1996.
No details of respective volumes were given in the report. CAAS officials could not be reached for comment.
State TV also said the International Federation of Airline Pilots Association had given Changi a deficiency-free rating.

Changi is to undergo extensive development during the next seven years after being given the go-ahead in December to build a Singapore $1.5 billion third terminal that would extend passenger capacity by about 20 million a year to 64 million annually when it opens in 2004.

CAAS officials have said the third terminal would add 25 new aerobridge gates and link Changi's "Skytrain" passenger transport system to all three terminals. The airport is expected to be linked soon to Singapore's Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) rail network. An MRT station is proposed for siting between terminals two and three. -- Singapore newsroom (65 8703011)
